# Useful Resources üìö

Here's a curated list of external resources to complement your learning on Open Polyglot. These tools and platforms can help you practice, immerse yourself in German, and accelerate your progress.

## üìö Standard Resources

**[Leo](https://dict.leo.org/englisch-deutsch/)** - Comprehensive German-English dictionary with pronunciation guides

**[Duolingo](https://www.duolingo.com/)** - Gamified language learning for daily practice

**[Speechling](https://speechling.com/dictation)** - Dictation exercises to improve your listening and writing skills

**[Tobo App](https://www.toboapp.com/)** - Learn new vocabulary words with spaced repetition

**[DeepL](https://www.deepl.com/en/translator)** - High-quality translation tool (better than Google Translate for German!)

**[Deutsche Welle (A1 section)](https://learngerman.dw.com/en/beginners/s-62078399)** - Professional German courses from Germany's international broadcaster

**Deutsches W√∂rterbuch** - German dictionary app available on App Store / Play Store

---

## ‚ñ∂Ô∏è YouTube Channels

**[EasyGerman](https://www.youtube.com/@EasyGerman)** - Real German conversations with subtitles, super helpful for listening practice

**[CoffeeBreakGerman](https://www.youtube.com/@coffeebreakgerman)** - Relaxed, podcast-style German lessons

---

## üé• Movies / Series

Immerse yourself in German culture with these popular films and shows:

**Dark** (Netflix Series) - Mind-bending sci-fi thriller, one of Netflix's best German originals

**How to Sell Drugs Online (Fast)** (Series) - Comedy-drama about a teenager starting an online drug business

**T√ºrkisch f√ºr Anf√§nger** (Movie) - Comedy about a German-Turkish family

**Fack Ju G√∂hte 1, 2, 3** (Movie) - Comedy trilogy about a bank robber becoming a teacher

**Das Leben der Anderen** (Movie) - Oscar-winning drama about East German surveillance

**Honig im Kopf** (Movie) - Touching family drama about dementia

*Tip: Start with German audio and English subtitles, then switch to German subtitles as you improve!*

---

## ü§ñ Artificial Intelligence (Get quick answers to questions!)

**[Google Gemini](https://gemini.google.com/)** - Ask grammar questions, get explanations, practice conversations

**[ChatGPT](https://openai.com/index/chatgpt/)** - Great for explaining complex grammar concepts and generating practice exercises

*Tip: Use AI to practice conversations, ask for grammar explanations, or generate custom exercises based on your level!*

---

## üìï Workbook

You don't necessarily need a workbook to get to the A1 level. However, if you want to practice even more, I can personally recommend **"Das Leben A1"**.

---

## üí° Pro Tips

1. **Mix resources** - Use different tools for different skills (listening, reading, writing, speaking)
2. **Daily immersion** - Even 10 minutes of German content daily makes a huge difference
3. **Active learning** - Don't just consume passively; repeat phrases, write notes, practice speaking
4. **Join communities** - Find German learning groups on Reddit, Discord, or local meetups
5. **Be consistent** - Regular practice beats intense cramming every time

Remember: These resources supplement your learning on Open Polyglot. Use what works for you and don't feel pressured to use everything!
